newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Peters says widening NZ inflation band inevitable.
newsitem.headline: Peters says widening NZ inflation band inevitable.

text.p: New Zealand First leader Winston Peters said on Tuesday there was a "certain inevitability" about widening the Reserve Bank of New Zealand's zero to two percent target band for underlying inflation.
"I think there is a certain inevitability, yes," Peters told a news conference.

He said other prescriptions, such as a zero to three percent target band or the minus one to three proposed by the Labour Party, would also fail. In contrast, NZ First had long argued for a rate below the average of New Zealand's trading partners, which would give greater flexibility, with competitiveness.

Nationalist New Zealand First holds the balance of power after an inconclusive general election last month and is negotiating to form a coalition with either the caretaker National Party conservative government or centre-left Labour.
